title: Inventions by Decade
description: Can you guess when these famous inventions were created?

questions.question: In which decade was the telephone invented by Alexander Graham Bell?
questions.explanation: Alexander Graham Bell patented the telephone in 1876. His first successful experiment was on March 10, 1876, when he transmitted the famous words: 'Mr. Watson, come here, I want to see you.'

questions.question: In which decade did the Wright Brothers achieve the first powered flight?
questions.explanation: Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first sustained, controlled, powered heavier-than-air flight on December 17, 1903, at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina. The first flight lasted 12 seconds.

questions.question: In which decade was television first demonstrated to the public?
questions.explanation: Television was first publicly demonstrated in the 1920s. John Logie Baird gave the first public demonstration of a working television system in London in January 1926.

questions.question: In which decade was the World Wide Web invented by Tim Berners-Lee?
questions.explanation: Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web in 1989 while working at CERN in Switzerland. The first website went live on August 6, 1991.

questions.question: In which decade was the light bulb made commercially practical by Thomas Edison?
questions.explanation: Thomas Edison developed a commercially practical incandescent light bulb in 1879. While others had created electric lights before him, Edison's bulb was the first to last long enough for practical use.

questions.question: In which decade was penicillin discovered by Alexander Fleming?
questions.explanation: Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin in 1928 when he noticed that mold had killed bacteria in a petri dish. It was the first true antibiotic and revolutionized medicine.

questions.question: In which decade was the first personal computer, the Altair 8800, introduced?
questions.explanation: The Altair 8800, widely considered the first commercially successful personal computer, was introduced in 1975. It inspired Bill Gates and Paul Allen to found Microsoft.

questions.question: In which decade was the microwave oven accidentally invented?
questions.explanation: Percy Spencer accidentally discovered that microwaves could heat food in 1945 while working on radar equipment at Raytheon. The first commercial microwave oven was sold in 1947.

questions.question: In which decade was the first successful heart transplant performed?
questions.explanation: Dr. Christiaan Barnard performed the first successful human heart transplant on December 3, 1967, in Cape Town, South Africa. The patient, Louis Washkansky, survived for 18 days.

questions.question: In which decade was the iPhone first introduced?
questions.explanation: Apple's iPhone was first introduced by Steve Jobs on January 9, 2007, and went on sale on June 29, 2007. It revolutionized the smartphone industry and mobile computing.

questions.question: In which decade was the printing press invented by Johannes Gutenberg?
questions.explanation: Johannes Gutenberg invented the movable-type printing press around 1440 in Mainz, Germany. His Gutenberg Bible, printed around 1455, is considered the first major book printed with movable type in the West.

questions.question: In which decade was the first practical steam engine developed by Thomas Newcomen?
questions.explanation: Thomas Newcomen developed the first practical steam engine around 1712. It was primarily used to pump water out of coal mines and laid the groundwork for the Industrial Revolution.

questions.question: In which decade was the transistor invented at Bell Laboratories?
questions.explanation: The transistor was invented at Bell Laboratories in 1947 by John Bardeen, Walter Brattain, and William Shockley. It replaced vacuum tubes and became the foundation of all modern electronics.

questions.question: In which decade was dynamite invented by Alfred Nobel?
questions.explanation: Alfred Nobel invented dynamite in 1867 by mixing nitroglycerin with diatomaceous earth to create a stable explosive. The profits from his invention funded the Nobel Prizes after his death.

questions.question: In which decade was the first GPS satellite launched by the United States?
questions.explanation: The first GPS satellite, Navstar 1, was launched on February 22, 1978. The full GPS constellation became operational for civilian use in 1995, revolutionizing navigation worldwide.
